availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Florence, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Louisa V. Graves Dulaney on March 29, 1823. Father of John J. Dulaney, Robert K. Dulaney, Benjamin A. Dulaney, and Elizabeth L. Dulaney. Farmer in Boone County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Boone County in 1850. Farmer in Florence in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Florence in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 179B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 10.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 1.
